inn1.comm: flatter and slower outside off, the batsman defends it to the leg side
he waits on the back foot and whips the flatter delivery to midwicket
tossed up and slower outside off, Amla lets it go through to the keeper
tossed up further this time, drawing Amla forward in defence
pushed through outside off, Amla comes forward and defends it down the pitch
waits on the back foot and pushes it back towards the non-striker
bowls it on back of length on the leg stump line, de Kock defends it to square leg
that's better from the bowler, getting the line around off and middle. The batsman gets a touch squared up as he defends it to off
he doesn't like to wait, punches the fuller delivery firmly towards wide mid-on. The fielder does well to get a hand and keep them to a single
good bounce there for Chatara from length! That is taken in front of the face by the keeper after the batsman had left it alone
angles it in on the off stump, Amla defends it to mid-on
good line from the bowler! On a length just outside off, the batsman can't do anything other than defend it down the pitch
no feet movement from the batsman but where has this gone? To the cover boundary. He stands tall and crashes the wide delivery through the gap
straighter this time, the batsman dabs it towards midwicket for a single
some spin for the bowler, it turns a touch in but that is easily punched to mid off
stays in the crease and punches the flatter delivery back to the bowler
slower and tossed up, inviting the drive and Amla shows he was not sleeping, punches it through cover. It was not that full actually, played it on the up
comes forward and eases the tossed up delivery to long on for a single
he defends it off the back foot to the off side. More good bounce for Chatara.. that hit Amla quite high on the bat
wooo... he gets an angled delivery and whips it stylishly towards midwicket, where the fielder gets a hand and prevents a certain boundary
he punches this length delivery straight down the pitch, that hits the middle stump at the other end. Amla is lucky that the bowler didn't get a hand to that as he would have been miles out
looks to pull but this one doesn't get as high as he would have liked, adjusts to whip it through square leg
good line and length from Chatara, the batsman comes forward and defends it to mid off
Wo! What did that hit! This one was on a length and stops a touch. The batsman was looking to punch but played too early, lobbing the ball towards cover. He is lucky that it drops well short

WHoaa!! Drop followed by another drop!First drop by the bowler, second - the richochet - by the mid-on fielder charging in. Amla punches it in the air back down the pitch, and the bowler was not able to get his hands up in time. It hits his left shoulder and lobs behind him. The fielder has the harder attempt to make but he is not able to slide under it in time
bang! This time he decides to whip it rather than punch it. Finds the gap at midwicket. The bowler is bowling full as he is striving for swing.. but there isn't any
this one is even better! Vitori bowls it full and on the pads and Amla whips it to the deep square leg boundary. That was timed well.. Almost went for a six
fuller and on the pads again, the batsman whips it past the short midwicket fielder for another couple
length delivery on off, the batsman comes forward and punches it to mid off
shortens the length but still bowls on the pads, clipped easily to deep square leg for a single
length delivery on the stumps, Amla shuffles across and defends on midwicket
he misses out as this was short and wide! Amla mistimes it to the short cover fielder. That stops on the surface a touch again
the length is fuller but Amla is stuck on the crease, defended to midwicket
no timing again as he comes forward to drive the length delivery towards mid-off. That short cover would remain interested with shots like these
good tight line from the bowler, the batsman defends the back of length delivery to mid-on
another good over from Chatara. It's short of length outside off, not much the batsman can do about it. He defends
bowls on back of length and the batsman punches it to cover

goes fuller this time and hits the pads, asks a half-hearted question. This was always going down the leg side and de Kock played outside the line. His feet were stuck. But they take a leg bye through slip
stands tall and punches the length delivery to the gap at cover for a single
length ball outside off, de Kock brings his body weight forward - no feet movement - and defends it to cover
very lucky! de Kock tries to flay this full and wide delivery through cover but his feet do not move.. That takes the inside edge past the off stump and down to the boundary.

he gets another loosener to correct his mistake and crashes on this one. No feet movement again, but this one hits the middle and screams along the surface to the extra cover boundary. Superb, when it comes off
length delivery outside off, Amla hops and defends it to mid off
he stands tall behind the crease and defends the length delivery to cover. Chatara continues to get good bounce

Amla could have been in trouble at the non-striker's end! A direct hit and he was probably gone.. the batsman had pushed the fuller delivery softly towards mid-off before setting off. Had to run around the bowler a bit too
length delivery on the pads, clipped to square leg for a single
it cuts in from a length and surprises Amla, who was on the back foot. He manages to nudge it past midwicket for a single
fuller on the pads, another single to square leg
ooh! The batsman almost chops this one on to his stumps but he is alert to boot it away
fuller delivery on the off and middle line, the batsman comes towards the line of the ball and defends
short and this has been easily dealt with. This was down the leg side and de Kock pulls it behind square for a boundary
there is not much room on this one but de Kock manages to create some with his open stance, cuts it behind point for another boundary. There was nothing wrong with that ball.
and now picks up a single with a dab to cover point
that was in the air for a bit too! The batsman wanted to clip it to square leg but gets a leading edge towards mid-on.

loud appeal for lbw, then a run-out chance at the non-striker's! Direct hit and Amla was gone again. The ball cut in and hit the batsman high on the thigh pad after taking an inside edge, but de Kock calls for a quick single. Nyumbu running from midwicket was only two meters away but couldn't hit the stumps
whips it from outside off to deep square leg for a single
he comes forward and punches it to mid off
fuller on the stumps, the batsman looks to flick it but adjusts late to punch it to mid-on. No timing there
length ball on the stumps. It is certainly stopping on this surface as Amla pushes it in the air past the short midwicket fielder for a single
fuller delivery on the pads, it's clipped to fine leg for a single
this is typical QdK. Spots the shortness in length early and whacks it over midwicket for a boundary. Doesn't move his feet, doesn't give a damn about the fielders.. just goes through
length delivery outside off, defends it to off
pulls the short ball down to fine leg. It stops a touch again.
he stays in the crease and opens the face to run it down to third man
charges down the pitch and looks to flay the short of length ball down the ground but gets a thick inside edge past the stumps to fine leg
extra bounce for the bowler! The batsman fends it off his gloves to midwicket and calls for a quick single
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman defends it to square leg
this time he plays it towards backward square leg with soft hands and calls for a quick single
slower and outside off, Amla pushes it with mid off with no timing
much slower, the batsman leans forward and eases it to long off
tossed up on the stumps, pushes to long on
comes forward and punches it to long off for another single.
tossed up outside off, pushed down to cover
comes down and drives the full toss down to long-off for one
flighted outside off, pushed down softly and cover dives to his left to stop that
beaten by the turn! Tossed up outside off, QDK prodded and it turned away to miss the outside edge
flighted around the same area, pushed to cover point this time
towards the pads and full, pushed down softly to mid-on
he comes down the pitch but defends as this is not full enough
he waits on the back foot and punches the length delivery to deep extra cover
full and flighted on the middle stump line, whipped easily to deep square leg for a single
in the air again as Amla looks to flick the fuller one through square leg but ends up playing it towards midwicket. Safe in the end
gets it off the outside half of the bat to point as he looks to drive
fuller and flighted, driven down to long on
uses his feet and looks to drive straight, but the bowler dives to his left to cut it off
drives it more towards mid-off this time and beats the diving bowler
now he charges down and creates room too, slicing it over cover. But not well timed again.. stops before reaching the boundary
nicely bowled! He tossed it up, got it to dip and got the outside edge as the batsman went for a drive.. No one at slips though
fuller and flighted on off, whipped to deep midwicket for a single
flatter and on the pads, not the delivery you want after getting a fielder placed for you.. Nudged behind square on the leg side
shorter and drifting down the leg side, the batsman pulls it down to deep backward square leg for a single
very very slow from Williams but Amla generates some pace with his steely wrists to whip it to deep midwicket
full and flighted on the middle stump, the batsman defends it to off
he comes down the pitch but is not close to the ball, defends down the pitch
turn! Beats the bat as Amla pokes lazily at it
takes a step down and punches the flatter delivery back down to the bowler

Slog, hammered over midwicket and it just lands inside the boundary. It was tossed up and de Kock shelves the plans to drive after the edge in the last over, using the cross-batted swipe for more impact
comes down the pitch and pushes it to wide mid-off for a single
tossed up on off, the batsman leans into it to push it to long off
very slow from the bowler, QdK gets hit on the pads as he has played his shot early. That was drifting down though
comes forward and pushes it to point
uses his feet to whip a flighted delivery to long on
waits on the back foot and works away a flatter delivery through square leg for a single that brings up yet another half-century for him. Only his third. Five hundreds though. Signs ominous
he comes forward and punches the fuller delivery back to the bowler
he waits on the back foot and punches the turning delivery to deep extra cover
short and wide outside off, the batsman waits for it and cracks it hard off the back foot to deep extra cover
now goes on the back foot and dabs it towards short fine leg for another quick single
tossed up on off, Amla slices it straight to point
fuller length delivery on the stumps, the batsman pushes it down to the bowler off the front foot
comes forward and solidly defends the length ball down the pitch
short ball this time, the batsman gets on top of it and pulls it down to fine leg
he shuffles across and clips the leg-sidish delivery to fine leg for a single
short ball outside off, gets helmet high, the batsman rolls his wrists and pulls it down to fine leg
he waits on the back foot and steers it down to third man for a single
flighted and full on the off stump, pushed back to the bowler
oh he charges down this time and tonks a massive six! Took a step down and the ball was not completely full be he got under it and lofted it over the long-on boundary
stops a little bit and turns before taking a thick outside edge to go to point
bit too short this time and Amla goes back to cut it to sweeper cover
tucked down the ground from outside off with the turn to long-on for one
comes down again and pushes it down to long-off with the turn for one
on length and angling way just outside off, Amla defends off the back foot towards point
fuller and outside off, turned with the wrists to deep backward square leg to bring up his 24th ODI fifty
full and towards the pads, helped to deep fine leg for a single
from wide of the crease into the pads, Amla looks to flick but manages a leg bye towards square leg
full on the pads and he's smoked that one! That's QDK's strong area and he put it away with rather ease over the wide long-on boundary for a massive six
on length outside off, driven straight to cover
flight, turn and that surprises the batsman as it zips past the outside edge
more turn there and he gets an outside edge! The batsman was looking to work it away to the leg side, but the outside edge runs fine and he gets a couple
flatter and on the stumps, he closes the bat face too early again, but manages to defend it to off
loud appeal for lbw as this hits the toe of the batsman going for a reverse-sweep! Bit of a bottom edge on that as it runs fine on the leg side
goes down on his knee early and laps it fine on the leg side for a couple. That wasn't off the middle of the bat and had he missed, it would have hit the middle stump
no half-measures here. He pulls out a powerful sweep to peg the square leg boundary
on the pads, easily nudged  to square leg for a quick single
comes down the pitch and whips the flighted delivery over midwicket for a single.. He got too close to the ball there
tossed up on the pads, the batsman paddles it fine on the leg side for a couple
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman comes forward and defends it to off
slightly short this time, allows the batsman to go back and punch it firmly through cover
some turn into the batsman, Amla stays back and punches it through mid off for a single
now Amla shows he can play the reverse sweep and he does it well! Gets better result than QdK's shot. In the gap and it runs down to the third man boundary
comes forward and clips it to fine leg with the turn
he comes forward and eases this to long off for a single
another reverse sweep! He wasn't in control of this one as he dragged it against the spin from middle stump.. gets top edge but luckily it's in the gap at backward point
drifting on to the pads and QdK goes for a big heave, misses and gets hit on the pads
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman comes forward and defends
tossed up and it hits the pads as it turns past the inside edge.. Was turning down the leg side

huge wicket there! It's not often you seen Amla get beaten completely like this! He comes down the pitch too early, is no where near the pitch of the delivery, which turns in to him. Amla sees it but it's too late for him to adjust. He is miles down the crease when the keeper whips the bails off. Some reward for good bowling from Utseya
waits on the back foot and punches it down the pitch
turns in and the batsman works it away to backward square leg for a single
takes a step down and drives it back to the bowler
big turn from the bowler! QdK gets an outside edge as he closes the bat too early, but it drops safely short of short third man
tossed up on off, the batsman comes forward and nudges it to cover for a single
reverse-sweeps it against the spin but can't beat the fielder at point
goes with the turn this time, clips it straight to short fine leg
stands tall in the crease and punches the flatter delivery to short midwicket
waits on the back foot and clips it to short fine leg
flatter and quicker on off, the batsman punches it down the ground to long on
tossed up on off, he dabs it to cover for a quick single
he goes down on his knee and laps the tossed up delivery fine on the leg side
big turn again! QdK was looking to drive it down the pitch and misses

and he is gone! Excellent one-hander by the fielder at short third-man.. It's Chatara. He looks to reverse-lap it over that fielder but just did not get enough bat on that. It still looked like it was going over but Chatara back-pedals and sticks his right hand out to pluck it. QdK.. for all it's worth.. can't score a hundred against Zimbabwe.

Rilee Rossouw! No. It has to be a tragedy if you are him! He was out for a duck in his first match and he is out for a duck here. Superb delivery though. It's tossed up, spins and Rossouw was stuck in the crease, pokes at it but can only get an outside edge. That is taken neatly by first slip

it's a hat-trick! Utseya is on the floor.. With his teammates over him. What bowling this! Tossed up but unlike the previous ones, doesn't turn much. Miller plays outside the line hoping for the spin. But gets hit right in front. No question about that. He lies on his back and starts rolling the pedals of his imaginary bike.. Why not! Superb stuff
he goes back to a flatter delivery and punches it to extra cover
tossed up on the stumps, pushed back down the ground and it hits the stumps .. JP is safe though
dabs it to short third man and calls fora  quick single
he waits on the back foot and defends the length delivery to off
comes down the pitch and punches the tossed up delivery to long on
rocks back and punches it to deep cover for a single
tossed up on the pads, worked away to deep midwicket off the front foot
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman pushes it to the off side
he comes forward and defends it to off
tossed up on the stumps, more front-foot defence from JP
stays back and punches the flatter on firmly to cover
loopy strangler! It was tossed up above the eye line and dips and turns to beat the front-foot defensive poke
he comes forward and defends the flatter delivery down the pitch
uses his feet and whips it straight to midwicket
he stays back and punches this flatter one to wide long off

possible run out at the non-striker's! Faf runs almost halfway down the pitch only to be sent back .. the ball was hit to short fine leg. JP almost sold him out there.. He took a few steps down before calling it off
he goes on the back foot and defends
stays in the crease and punches it to mid on
turns in from the middle stump, hits the pads as the batsman looks to work it away to leg side
goes back and punches it to long on for a single
tossed up on the stumps, JP paddles it to fine leg for a single
flighted delivery on the stumps, the batsman comes forward and pushes it to wide long on

another one! Umpire Ian Gould waits for the appeal to die.. then raises the finger to spark the delirium again. It looked good. JP plays outside the line of this tossed up delivery.. That would have hit leg stump.. Utseya has five.. He can't do anything wrong today..
tossed up delivery, the batsman stretches forward and defends to cover
tossed up outside off, the batsman clips it to deep midwicket with the turn
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman defends it to cover
flighted and full on the stumps, he dabs it to mid-off to get off the mark
tossed up on the tump, turns and hits the pads
he comes forward and defends this one to the leg side
uses his feet and drives it to long off for a single
short and outside off, he goes back to punch it to cover
off the back foot again, this one's turning into him and he tucks it behind square on the leg side
on length without much turn outside off, cut off the back foot to cover point
full towards the pads, easily tucked towards midwicket to change the strike
slower through the air and pitches it on length on off, Faf defends on off
comes down and drives it down to long-on with the turn
uses his feet again and tucks this full delivery to deep midwicket and calls early for two

oh, Nyumbu's struck too, and he's got the big wicket! What a soft dismissal for Faf, he went back for the slightly short of length ball outside off to help it with the turn to the leg side but chipped it straight to Raza at midwicket. That stopped on him big time. Utseya is not going to take 10 afterall
he gets off the mark with a nudge to backward square leg
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman watches it carefully and defends it to silly point
slightly short, allows the batsman to rock back and punch, but he can't beat cover
flighted on off stump, the batsman defends it down the pitch
decent first ball, right on target though. The batsman defends
pushes this down the leg side and it turns further down
another one down the leg side, but this is closer to the batsman. Not give a wide
tossed up outside off, Steyn comes forward and defends
fuller and on the middle stump, he flicks it to deep square leg for a single
tossed up outside off but McLaren paddles it fine neatly for a single
another one turning down the leg side

poor delivery! It's down the leg side and the turn takes it away from the keeper too. he doesn't get any hand to it. Does that tun to the boundary? Nyumbu slides and tries to keep it in, but he is touching the rope
he walks across the stumps to deflect it to the leg side but this one doesn't turn. He is lucky to get some bat on it, and luckier that it drops short of the leg gully fielder
flighted but straying down the leg side, easily nudged to backward square leg for a single
flatter delivery on the stumps, clumsily defended to short leg
he comes forward and clips it to backward square leg for a single
flighted but again down the leg side, swept to deep backward square leg for a single
he comes forward to defend and gets an inside edge towards backward square leg for a single
tossed up on the stumps, McLaren defends towards mid-on
bowls a yorker to Steyn, who digs it out
floated up to the batsman who drives it back to the bowler
he comes down the pitch and looks for the big hit but gets a thick inside edge past midwicket for a single
tossed up on the stumps, Mclaren defends it to cover
this one is pushed through outside off, the batsman leaves it alone
lots of air on this one, the batsman takes it on the full and whips it to wide long on.. It brings an end to an excellent spell. He gets applause from everyone
looks to sweep but can't beat short fine leg
he goes back and punches it straight to cover
slower this time from the bowler, the batsman defends it towards cover point
waits an extra second and punches it to cover point again

Oh no! South Africa! Another delayed cry of joy from Zimbabweans as they realise McLaren has swept this one on to his stumps. This was headed down the leg side, and the batsman went for a sweep, got some sort of an edge to his pads but the ricochet from the pads caught his gloves and rolled back to the stumps.. Bowled round the legs.. Innocuous delivery it seemed
massive spin from wide outside off! It hits the pads but this was spinning down the leg side
flighted but too full, defended to the leg side
flatter on the stumps, the batsman stays back and pushes it to cover point
ooh.. he gets a leading edge to the off side as he closes the bat face too early
quicker one on the stumps, defended down the pitch
pushed through down the leg side and it's a wide
slower this time, the batsman nudges it fine on the off side for a quick single
massive turn and good bounce too.. Nothing Abbott could have done about it. Getting beaten was the luckier option
tossed up on off, Steyn defends down the pitch
looks for the big slog from wide outside off, but he is beaten by the turn.. It slips under the bat
waits on the back foot and dabs the flatter delivery to the leg side
he hops around the crease but defends it in the end
waits on the back foot and defends this to short third man
again goes for a big hit but it hits the inside of the bat, which means it drops short of the long on fielder..
pushed through on the pads, it's tickled to short fine leg for a single
fuller on the pads, pushed to long on for a single
he comes forward and pushes it to midwicket
poor delivery, it's pushed down the leg side
much shorter this time, the batsman punches it through the gap at cover for a couple
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman comes forward to defend, gets an outside edge to short third man
slower and on the stumps, the batsman defends it with ease
tossed up on the stumps, he nudges it to square leg with the turn for a single
tossed up on the stumps, Steyn defends to off
appeal for caught behind down the leg side.. Nothing on that, but that wasn't too far from the leg stump
pushed down the leg side.. Steyn has seen a few wides down the leg side now
he shuffles across and lets it go as it's turning down leg. Called wide again. but that was a nanometer away from the leg stump
goes for the big drive and times it well, but finds the man at cover
this is what he has been doing! Walking across the stumps and leaving deliveries and getting wides.. This one is smacks the leg stump. Third wicket for Nyumbu
fires it through, Phangiso does well to defend it to the leg side
pushed through outside off, driven to long off for a single
flatter and spins big, somehow Phangiso keeps it out
he gets off the mark with a push towards wide long on
flatter and quicker on off, Abbott defends to off
not much spin this time! The batsman plays inside the line and is beaten
he eases it to long off for a single
length delivery on the pads, nudged to deep square leg for a single
fuller and on the stumps, the batsman pushes it to mid off
another full delivery and the batsman fails to get it away, gets hit on the pads, but that was going down
short delivery, the batsman hops on the crease and defends to off
he looks to get rid of the stranglehold with a big shot but gets nothing behind it! It was a back of length delivery and Abbott just lobs it to mid-off for a simple catch
gets a bouncer first up and sways away from the line
tossed up outside off, the batsman looks to push it to off but gets an inside edge to square leg
full, almost a yorker, the batsman squeezes it to point
flatter and quicker outside off, the batsman chops it to cover point
looks to cut seeing the line of the ball but it spits in to surprise Tahir.. he gets a glove that takes it just past the leg stump
stays behind the line of this and defends to off
fuller and flighted, he squeezes it through cover for more runs
length ball on the pads, easily clipped to fine leg for a single
length ball on off, defended solidly off the back foot
fuller delivery on the stumps but Tahir stays back, manages to keep it out
short and wide, easy enough for Tahir to go back and punch it through cover point for more runs
that's a better length! Fuller and just outside off. Phangiso is beaten as he pushes inside the line
length delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends it down the pitch
length delivery on the stumps, the batsman shows the maker's name to the bowler.. Actually there is no maker's name.. The bat is without a sticker
crash! Short and wide and Tahir whacks it through cover. That was an easy delivery but Tahir takes full toll
short delivery but Vitori has no pace. The batsman fends it to off and calls for a quick single
back of length on the stumps, whipped away to deep square leg for a single
looks to punch this through off side but gets cramped for room, ends up pushing it tamely to off
full and wide outside off, Tahir shows he can play golf too..Swings it over mid-off comfortably for four more
length delivery outside off, Phangiso comes forward and defends
length delivery on off, the batsman dabs it to the gap at cover for a single
full and quick, but down the leg side
he looks to push it to off but gets an inside edge to the leg side
charges down the pitch and punches this one firmly to mid off
short and wide, he pushes it to wide mid-off for a quick single
looks to upper cut as he gets a sharp bouncer but makes no contact
if Tahir can hit, so can Phangiso. He lofts a fuller delivery over mid-off for two more runs
back of length on the leg stump, it's clipped behind square on the leg side for a quick couple
throws his bat at this length ball but gets an inside edge to deep backward square leg
slower delivery on the stumps, he dabs it to point and calls for a quick single
this is all over the place! The batsman looks to clip it to fine leg but gets a leading edge to third man.. Does a complete 360 degree turn to see where the ball has gone
looks to guide this short of length delivery to third man but is baten
he looks to play the ramp at a yorker but does get some bat on it, picks up a single to short fine
superb hit! We know Tahir can play golf.. He gets a full delivery and hoicks it extra cover with an attractive swing.. just lands inside the boundary
short ball on the body, he whips it off his hips to deep backward square leg
slower delivery on the stumps, the batsman is beaten by the pace and can only push it as far as the bowler
All over! He goes for the big swing and gets a thick outside edge to the keeper.

inn2.comm: good carry as it's on length outside off with outswing and he lets it go
falls just short of the keeper this time after pitching on similar line and shaping away, Mawoyo leaves again
back of length outside off with outswing and Mawoyo goes back to cut it and point stops it over his head after a bounce
short of length outside off again, another back-foot cut and he can't middle it. Gets a bottom edge
back to how he started - good-length outswinger outside off is left alone
good carry again as Mawoyo leaves it for a maiden after it pitched outside off and swung away again
full and wide, drives it to cover point after going down on a knee
on length and coming in, thick outside off runs down to third man and he's off the mark
brings it into the batsman from length on off stump and he replies with a solid defence
stifled appeal for lbw as this one hit the pad in front of leg but was going down leg
goes for the drive for a length delivery outside off but it didn't move much and beat the outside edge
brings it in again towards off and Mawoyo defends it back
back of length and swinging away, Raza goes for a back-foot drive but the bounce and swing beats him
coming into the batsman who stays back and brings his bat down just in time to defend it on the leg side
comes in a bit again, with bounce! Raza stayed back in the crease for the inswinger which pitched outside off and just missed the off stump
bit of outswing this time from outside off and Raza lets it go

big appeal for run out and the SA players are celebrating! Raza pushed it down towards mid-off and they ran for a very risky single, Raza might have made it on time but David Miller threw it to the keeper's end where QDK did well to whip the bails off and he was out by a mile! Mawoyo took his time to set off for the run as he was ball watching initially. Silly mistake to begin with for Zimbabwe
welcomes him with a short ball outside off and he lets it go
back of length outside off, Raza looked to play but withdrew his bat at the last moment
short of length and angled into the batsman, he taps it towards midwicket for one
goes even shorter! Nearly a bouncer as it was coming into him and Hammy did well to drop his hands and sway out of the line
short and outside off again, not too wide, left easily
goes full this time and Masakadza drives it through the covers to get off the mark. He gets three for finding the gap
width on offer and that's launched and how! It was full too and as if he was expecting it, he went for a powerful swish to send it into the stands over the extra cover boundary
on the off stump from short of length, pushed towards cover
away movement again from Steyn form short of length, he chased it and missed
runs down the back of length delivery to third man for one
nearly on off stump and swinging away from length, Raza's good judgement makes him leave it carefully
terrific back-foot punch and it's gone for four! Short of length and he got more width with the outswing, he went back and crunched it through the covers for a four
straight delivery on length just outside off to end the over and Raza lets it go
outside off from Abbott and the batsman lets it go
good carry for the short of length ball outside off and left alone again
fuller outside off and it's driven firmly to mid-off
short ball this time outside off and it rises suddenly, he sways out of the line and plays it with soft hands to point
angled towards the middle stump now, flicked off the pads just wide of mid-on for one
makes room towards the leg side and cuts the short delivery straight to point
bouncer to begin the over and the batsman ducks under it
short of length just outside off, he tries to punch it off the backfoot but can't middle it
good-length ball outside off, he defends it towards cover
beats the edge again, with swing and bounce! Masakadza stayed back to cut the short delivery but it goes over his bat
just around off, whipped off the back foot to mid-on

in the air for a long time but it falls safe! Steyn launched a bouncer and Masakadza didn't look very comfortable while hooking it and the top edge went towards deep fine leg but it fell short of deep backward square leg who was running in
good bounce again and Masakadza withdraws his bat just in time for this one outside off
it's full this time and Masakadza cashes in! He picked the length of this one around off and tonked it to the long-on boundary for a one-bounce four
punches the short of length ball to cover

short and smoked! Masakadza's in some mood to launch these out of the parks! He made room and made full use of the short ball by pulling it from the meat of the bat to the midwicket boundary. That was six the moment it left the bat
short ball and goes down leg for a wide
slower ball on length outside off, pushed to cover point by leaning forward
shortish ball towards the pads and he calls early for the leg bye which went to square leg
bangs it in outside off and he defends off his toes
the fine leg's in the circle and does he know it? He does and paddle sweeps Dale Steyn past short fine leg for a four
tucks the ball from outside off towards mid-on and the fielder nearly gave an overthrow
on length just outside off, firm drive from Masakadza for the outswinger but Duminy gets there from cover
taps the length ball outside off softly towards cover and Raza responds quickly for the quick single
makes room, typical Raza style, and smashes the full delivery that was shaping away over the covers for a four! Nine runs from that over
on off stump on length and defends it back
touch shorter as the batsman looks to tuck it to leg, thick edge flies towards short third man
'catch it' is the call but is gone just over backward square leg. Masakadza swept the ball from outside off and didn't middle it but it had enough to go over the fielder

through the defence! Phangiso drifted it in with flight on the off stump but the ball went with the angle and found the huge gap between bat and pad to strike the leg stump. Big wicket Zimbabwe have lost
flighted on off, he presses forward and blocks

huge huge lbw appeal turned down! Phanigso kept jumping while appealing as it hit the front pad on the full when Taylor looked to sweep in front of off stump. Or was it in front of off? Replays confirm it was and Taylor is lucky to survive that
short ball to begin with and he ducks under it
slightly slower and cuts in, Raza blocks it back
back of length outside off, he goes back to punch it to cover
touch shorter outside off, he defends it to point
short ball again and Raza pulls it to deep square leg off the toes
short ball down the leg side for a wide
full and wide outside off, easy leave for Taylor
flighted just outside off, blocked back by Raza
comes down the track now and blocks the length delivery
slightly full around off, pushed towards midwicket
tossed up on off stump, pushed down the ground to long-off for one

he gets another, bowled him! Drifted this flighted delivery in towards off stump, Taylor played for the turn and left the gap between bat and pad while leaning forward, and the ball sneaked through to knock the top of off stump
flatter and fuller outside off, left alone easily
top edge and it flies high over the keeper on the leg side for four! It was short but Raza's bat came down late and he managed an edge to get four runs
bouncer again and Raza ducks under it without any troubles
full and wide this time, Raza drives it with power off the back foot and the fielder at point dives to his left to stop it
short of length outside off and coming in, tucked with the angle to deep fine leg for one
short and wide and Williams crunches it past point to sweeper cover
angles it in from short of length, Raza hops back to defend it back
slightly full outside off, pushed down to long-on for one
comes down the track to defend it back
another step down the track and he blocks it before it turns
uses his feet again and he wanted to smash it but drove it down to long-on
turning in from length outside off, tucked to deep backward square leg
touch shorter outside off and he cuts off the back foot to deep point
onto the pads with the angle, softly tucked towards mid-on for a quick single
quick delivery around middle and off, Williams defends with his bat coming down a bit late
touch fuller and it's pushed down to mid-off
outside off with the angle, tapped towards point off the back foot
short of length this time and the away angle again, defends to point
short on the leg side, pulled towards deep fine leg for one
short of length and turning in, swatted to deep midwicket for one
on leg stump and drifting down leg, runs it fine down the leg side off the back foot for three
tossed up outside off on length, he nearly chipped it back to the bowler, but it went to his left and down to long-on
comes down the track and gets hit on the pad while trying to drive it from outside off
goes to the back foot this time and blocks it on leg
fuller and middle and leg, pushed down to long-on and it's drinks! Doctor will take you through till the next break
shorter delivery outside off, the batsman drags it to wide long-on with a laboured pull
this is more like it! Halfway down the pitch. The batsman chips it to long on off the back foot
bowls the googly but this is wide enough, cut away to deep cover
another short delivery but this bounces a touch too high, the batsman defends it to point
some more extra bounce and from a length this time.. Hits the handle as the batsman comes forward to defend
he spots the googles and nudges it to square leg for a single
slower and looped outside off, the batsman cuts it to point
superb delivery! There is only a smidgen of spin but it's enough to beat the batsman's forward prod.. misses the off stump by a nanomile
he comes forward and tentatively pushes this one to cover
slower and tossed up on off, the batsman pushes it to cover
he teases the batsman with another loopy one, the batsman defends
he goes back and works the shorter one to deep square leg for a single

Tahir Tahir! Gets a wicket early on in his spell! But you have to question Raza's choice of shot. He just launches into this flighted delivery and holes out at long off. He saw the kind of bounce Tahir was getting in the previous over.. still goes on with the shot.. It hit him higher on the bat
gets a full toss but fails to put it away.. Finds the man at cover.
gets the googly now, which thuds on to his front pad as he looks to work it to the leg side, was going down
uses the sweep to get off the mark, picks up a single to deep square leg
slider! Williams was looking to play it with the spin but this one just glides across, beating the bat
quicker and fuller, the batsman digs it out down the pitch
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman pushes it through cover for a single
looks to paddles it from wide outside off but gets hit on the pads. That was outside the line of off, so he is safe
stays back and nudges the flatter delivery to midwicket
shorter this time but the batsman goes for a sweep anyway, gets an underedge down to fine leg
he goes deep in the crease and nonchalantly flicks it to deep square leg, just a single though
the crowd finds its voice as Williams steps out to smoke a tossed up delivery over long-off.. Hits the boundary skirting on the full
flighted delivery, the batsman takes it on the full and paddles it to deep backward square leg
he waits in the crease and drags the legspinning delivery to midwicket
slightly short, allows the batsman to go back and drag it to deep midwicket
floated dangerously up to the batsman, who comes forward and defends it to cover
cuts it to the right of point and calls for a quick single as Phangiso doesn't make a clean stop
comes forward and punches the flighted delivery to cover
starts off with a fuller delivery, the batsman drives it to deep cover

dropped! The batsman gets a thick outside edge from a short of length delivery as he looks to cut.. But de Kock dives to the right... #, at first slip, dives to his left.. the ball decides to beat both.. Both should have independently taken it easily
stands tall and punches the back of length delivery through cover
gets into a tangle as he sees this bouncer.. but it's one of those french-open type slower once.. Luckily for the batsman, it's down the leg side
short outside off, the batsman is quick to latch on to it as he pulls it over midwicket but there is not much timing behind that one
back of length outside off, the batsman waits on the back foot and cuts it to point
he is not going to hold back.. Waller creams this flighted delivery over the infield for a four
comes forward and defends the flatter delivery to cover
comes forward and squeezes the tossed up delivery to deep cover
flatter outside off, the batsman goes back and punches it to deep point
leans forward to drive the flighted one to deep extra cover
good clean hit! He goes along with the spin and lofts it over the bowler's head but Miller, running in from long on, cuts it off
he comes forward and punches the length delivery to cover where Faf flies around and makes a one-handed stop
he is surprised by the slower bouncer again.. but it's a wide down the leg side
he wanted to punch this through cover but hits it to midwicket as the bat rotates in his hands
waits for the back of length delivery but cannot pierce the crowded point region
now he picks up a single towards cover with a soft shot.. plus a bonus run as no one was backing up
beautiful shot! Comes forward and punches the length delivery down the ground. Rossouw makes himself useful and saves more runs than his career ODI tally
back of length on the pads, the batsman clips it to short fine leg
length ball on the middle stump line, the batsman clips it through midwicket for a single
looks to hit this length ball through the line, but doesn't get any timing.. finds short cover
he targets the stumps with a fuller length. Waller is stuck in the crease but manages to push it back down the pitch
he doesn't want to come forward. Punches a length ball to cover
smart shot! It's short outside off, not much room there, but Waller arches back and ramps it over the slip cordon for a pretty useful boundary
length ball, the batsman defends it from the crease
full and flighted, pushed back down the pitch
slower and on the stumps, the batsman leans forward and defends it solidly

superb reverse sweep! He takes it from in front of leg stump and powers it through cover.. The fielder was running towards point, anticipating the shot, but didn't expect it to come this straight. Had he not moved, he could have stopped that
flatter and shorter, swatted to deep midwicket
the line is on the pads and Waller calmly sweeps it down to fine leg
floated up to the batsman, driven to long off for a single
length ball, the batsman dabs it to cover for a quick single

Waller's spoons it straight to deep square leg! The fielder doesn't even move. It was short  and the batsman wanted to take it on, so went for the pull but didn't get the distance he would have wanted. Halfway there and half the side is gone. I can see Beyonce's image fading
short ball, Williams is not going to hold back.. pulls it along the ground to deep midwicket boundary. This one was played along the ground though
teases the batsman with a fuller and wider one. Williams leaves it alone
he leans forward and punches the length ball straight to short cover
back of length, the batsman punches it off the back foot but can't beat JP at cover
tossed up on the stumps, the batsman chooses to play it off the back foot, punches it to long on
flatter and on the leg stump line, the batsman goes back and works it away to deep square leg
comes forward and calmly pushes the tossed up delivery to deep cover
he stays back and punches the length ball down to long on
plays a fuller delivery off the back foot, pushes it back to the bowler
stays back again.. slightly cramped as the ball keeps coming in, deflects it to midwicket
flatter and quicker on off, pushed back to the bowler
quicker and on the stumps, the batsman works it away to deep midwicket
slower this time, Elton wanted to work it away to square leg but is not able to pick the gap
fuller on the toes, the batsman digs it out to long on
quicker delivery on the stumps, the batsman defends
this is too full, powered down the ground with ease for another boundary
he uses his feet and eases the loopy delivery to long off
pushes this through on the pads, tucked away to deep backward square leg for a single
tossed up, the batsman comes forward and defends it to off
what happened there! The bails come off as the batsman goes back to punch it to cover.. .. It's QdK.. His gloves give the batsman a bit of a scare
waits on the back foot and punches it down to long on
lots of loop again, the batsman comes forward and pushes it to cover
turning in from short of length outside off, swatted down to long-on
googly coming towards the stumps, Chigumbura blocks it back
flatter and just outside off, the batsman looked to cut off the back foot but missed
fuller on length, pushed towards cover for one
flighted around off, tucked to midwicket
flighted on off stump, drives it down to long-on for one
slightly full outside off, pushed down to long-off
on length and angling in, Williams defends it back
short of length and outside off, tapped to point off the backfoot
slower bouncer well outside off, Williams leaves and that's a wide

McLaren has struck! He pitched it up on the off stump and Williams flicked it straight to Amla at midiwcket for an easy catch around chest height. Williams is distraught with himself after playing that shot!
angling in from length outside off, he defends it back
short ball cutting in, pulled behind square on the leg side for one
flighted full toss on off stump, pushed down to long-off for one
on length on middle stump, he defends it after the turn
touch fuller on middle and off, pushed towards cover with the turn
shorter and wider, he goes back to cut it but can't middle it and it goes to cover again
flat and in the block hole from Tahir, another variation, it's dug down to long-on
tossed up well outside off, driven firmly straight to cover
length delivery coming in sharply, Chigumbura blocks it on the off side
angling in again, super drive straight down the ground past the bowler for a four! That was hit with some power and timing
short of length towards the leg side, tucked off the pad to deep fine leg for one
length delivery well outside off, left alone easily
short ball towards leg, pulled with the angle to deep fine leg
length delivery outside off, cut off the back foot to point
flighted on off and it's paddle-swept fine on the leg side for one
googly comes in towards the batsman from outside off, he can't get it away
drifting in towards off stump with flight, he presses forward and blocks
flighted on middle stump now, pushed down easily to long-on
flighted full toss around off, driven past short cover for one more
short of length on leg, swatted by going down on one knee to deep square leg in the gap and that's drinks
starts by straying down the leg side for a wide

he strikes again, and this one's caught behind! It cut in a touch after pitching on short of length and Utseya looked to run it down to third man but got an edge to de Kock who took the easy catch. Seven down now Zimbabwe

short ball gets the wicket this time, McLaren gets two in two! The ball jabbed in sharply and rose after pitching, Nyumbu dropped his arms but the ball touched something before being pouched by QDK and the finger went up. Replays suggest the ball touched the arm guard, not the glove. Nyumbu is unhappy
on length outside off and he lets it go
another shot ball rises too much! It was short of length and cut in again and hit the batsman's Chest after the bounce surprised him
fuller this time outside off and he defends it towards cover point
rolls his fingers over this one as it lands in the block hole on off, Chatara blocks it back
it's on target on the stumps but he's not scared to put it away in the air over the in-field which he clears easily and gets a one-bounce boundary to the long-on area for a four
falls short of mid-off! the attempted yorker turned into a low full toss on off which was smashed down the ground and fell just short of Miller
another one, this also goes for four! Short ball on the stumps, he makes a bit of room and tonks it back past the bowler

full toss again and this one gets a wicket! Steyn's being trying a yorker and this full toss was on the pads, Chigumbura flicked it away to the leg side but found the deep backward square leg fielder where Rossouw took a catch running in
nasty short ball as it goes off the pad and thigh guard behind square on the leg side
makes room to slap it away but gets a bottom edge from the length delivery on the off side
short balls continue - Chatara misses the pull and takes one near the shoulder as he played it early
much fuller around off and Chatara plays a cross-batted heave over the infield on the leg side to collect a boundary
back to the short ball - this one's going towards leg and it's helped with a pull to deep fine leg
short on the leg stump, Vitori gets off the mark with a pull which produces a leading edge towards square leg
in the block hole well outside off, Chatara chases and misses
another swing and a miss, this was on length outside off, he tried another heave and missed
short ball on leg, miscued pull falls well short of short midwicket

another short ball - another pull - and another one falls safe! Vitori pulled this one from leg stump towards the edge of the circle past mid-on and Phangiso ran to his left and jumped like Boris Becker but couldn't get there. Excellent effort, nevertheless
he's gone now, easy catch for QDK over his head! Steyn banged one in again and this was around off, Vitori looked for the upper cut but managed an outside edge behind the stumps
